ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend the class, just be prepared for a lot more theory than you might expect. If you put a lot into the class and do the readings you will get quite a bit out of it.

I would recommend the course as an easy way to cover thematic issues in international politics and to read some important authors and texts, but but I am not sure I would talk the course up as too engaging or critical.

The course offers a very broad introduction to diverse institutions which will offer new ways of thinking about the problems they face and stimulate ideas for further enquiries into their effectiveness.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The class was a preliminary introduction to very important areas, actors, and themes in international politics. It also met my degree's comparative politics-related requirement.
